brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of study is to compare the effect of coagulation profile in patients receiving
      intraoperative balanced salt colloid  undergoing spinal cord tumor surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Balanced Slat Colloid HES 130/0.42 on Coagulation Profiles in Patients Undergoing Spinal Cord Tumor Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult patients over the age of 20 scheduled for spinal tumor removal and fixation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  1. Renal failure 2. Preexisting congestive heart failure(NYHA III ~ IV) 3. Anemia 4.
             Coagulopathy 5. Abnormal liver function 6. Anti coagulation/Anti platelet ,edication
             7. Foreigner, illiterate 8. Disabled person,

intervention.description: Maximum dose : 30ml/kg, IV, The infusion of valanced salt colloid is started at bleeding and continued until reach at maximum dose
Maximum dose : 30ml/kg, IV, The infusion of valanced salt crystalloid is started at bleeding and continued until reach at maximum dose

clinical_study.keyword: balanced salt colloid, coagulation profiles, spinal cord tumor

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: ROTEM, CBC, PT/aPTT,ABGA, Lactic acid, electrolyte
primary_outcome.measure: Compare the effect of coagulation profile in patients receiving intraoperative balanced salt colloid  undergoing spinal cord tumor surgery.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
